org.knime.core.node.util.filter.column

Class DataColumnSpecFilterConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.knime.core.node.util.filter.NameFilterConfiguration
      • org.knime.core.node.util.filter.column.DataColumnSpecFilterConfiguration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable

    public final class DataColumnSpecFilterConfiguration
extends NameFilterConfiguration
    Represents a column filtering. Classes of this object are used as member in the NodeModel and as underlying model to a DataColumnSpecFilterPanel.
    Since:
    2.6
    Author:
    Bernd Wiswedel, KNIME.com, Zurich, Switzerland, Patrick Winter, KNIME.com AG, Zurich, Switzerland

        public static final int FILTER_BY_DATATYPE
        Mask passed in the constructor to enable a data type based filter ().

        See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataColumnSpecFilterConfiguration

        public DataColumnSpecFilterConfiguration(String configRootName)
        New instance with hard coded root name. This constructor enable a pattern and type filter.
        Parameters:
        configRootName - Non null name that is used as identifier when saved to a NodeSettings object during save (and load).

      • DataColumnSpecFilterConfiguration

        public DataColumnSpecFilterConfiguration(String configRootName,
                                         InputFilter<DataColumnSpec> filter)
        New instance with hard coded root name. This constructor enables only a name pattern filter (as a data value class filter is applied).
        Parameters:
        configRootName - Non null name that is used as identifier when saved to a NodeSettings object during save (and load).
        filter - A (type) filter applied to the input spec (null allowed)

      • DataColumnSpecFilterConfiguration

        public DataColumnSpecFilterConfiguration(String configRootName,
                                         InputFilter<DataColumnSpec> filter,
                                         int filterEnableMask)
        New instance with hard coded root name. The flags argument enables or disables certain filter types. This filter supports NameFilterConfiguration.FILTER_BY_NAMEPATTERN and FILTER_BY_DATATYPE. To enable both use the bit-wise or ('|') operator (e.g. FILTER_BY_NAMEPATTERN | FILTER_BY_DATATYPE).
        Parameters:
        configRootName - Non null name that is used as identifier when saved to a NodeSettings object during save (and load).
        filter - A (type) filter applied to the input spec (null allowed)
        filterEnableMask - The mask to enable filters. 0 will disable all filters but the default in/exclude; NameFilterConfiguration.FILTER_BY_NAMEPATTERN will enable the name pattern filter.
        Since:
        2.9

      • verifyType

        protected boolean verifyType(String type)
        Called by the load routines to check whether the argument type string is valid. This implementation accepts NameFilterConfiguration.TYPE and PatternFilterConfigurationImpl.TYPE (if pattern filter is enabled). Subclasses override it to accept additional identifiers.
        Overrides:
        verifyType in class NameFilterConfiguration
        Parameters:
        type - The type identifier
        Returns:
        if valid (if not valid a fallback is used)

      • loadDefaults

        public void loadDefaults(DataTableSpec spec,
                         boolean includeByDefault)
        Guess default settings on the argument spec. If the flag is set all appropriate columns will be put into the include list, otherwise they are put into the exclude list.
        Parameters:
        spec - To load from.
        includeByDefault - See above.

      • loadDefault

        public void loadDefault(DataTableSpec spec,
                        InputFilter<DataColumnSpec> filter,
                        boolean filterDefinesIncludeList)
        Applies default values and resets the current configuration (if any).
        Parameters:
        spec - The actual input spec (must not be null).
        filter - A filter that defines which of the columns in spec go into the include list (or exclude list if filterDefinesIncludeList is false). This argument may be null, which is equivalent to a match-all filter object. Note, the filter as per the constructor is still used as any column that's not suitable by this configuration is ignored.
        filterDefinesIncludeList - If true the columns for which InputFilter.include(Object) returns true will be put in the include list (otherwise into the exclude list). Also, if true the "enforce inclusion" option is set in the dialog
        Since:
        2.9

      • getFilter

        public InputFilter<DataColumnSpec> getFilter()
        Returns the filter used by this configuration.
        Returns:
        a reference to the filter. Don't modify.
